snippet: A Brooklyn pastor with close ties to Mayor Bill de Blasio was arrested and then released in an unusual turn of events that included a call from the mayor to a top police commander late Monday night.
abstract: Bishop Orlando Findlayter, Brooklyn pastor with close ties to New York Mayor Bill de Blasio, is arrested and then released in an unusual turn of events that included a call from the mayor to a top police commander; mayor's office and police say de Blasio's call came after a precinct commander had already decided to release the clergyman, who was driving with a suspended license.

byline.contributor: Susan C. Beachy, J. David Goodman and Michael M. Grynbaum contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A Brooklyn pastor with close ties to Mayor Bill de Blasio was arrested and then released in an unusual turn of events that included a call from the mayor to a top police commander late Monday night.

headline.main: Mayor’s Call Did Not Prompt Pastor’s Release, Police Say
headline.print_headline: Mayor’s Call Did Not Prompt Pastor’s Release, Police Say
